meanings.definition: A person who navigates or directs the course of a ship or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The avigators carefully plotted the route for the ship to follow.
meanings.sent2: The avigators on the ship guided it safely through the storm.
meanings.sent3: The avigators joked about taking a wrong turn and ending up on a deserted island.
meanings.sent4: The avigators were the stars of the crew, steering the ship with precision.
meanings.sent5: The avigators' expertise in navigation saved the day during the voyage.

meanings.definition: A device or system used for navigation.
meanings.sent1: The avigators relied on the latest technology to navigate the aircraft.
meanings.sent2: The avigators checked the accuracy of the navigation system before takeoff.
meanings.sent3: The avigators found humor in the quirky sounds the navigation device made.
meanings.sent4: The avigators' new navigation tool revolutionized their travel efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The avigators' trust in the navigation equipment never wavered during the journey.
